 21  import numpy as np 
 22  from imusim.maths.quaternions import Quaternion, QuaternionArray 
 23   

 24 -def assertQuaternionAlmostEqual(q1, q2, tol=1e-6, errMsg=""): 

 25      """ 
 26      Test whether two quaternions are equal within a given tolerance. 
 27      """ 
 28      if isinstance(q1, Quaternion): 
 29          assert(isinstance(q2, Quaternion)) 
 30          assert(np.allclose(q1.components, q2.components, atol=tol) or 
 31                  np.allclose((-q1).components, q2.components, atol=tol)), \ 
 32                  "Quaternions not almost equal: %r <> %r" %(q1, q2) +'\n' + \ 
 33                  errMsg 
 34      elif isinstance(q1, QuaternionArray): 
 35          assert(isinstance(q2, QuaternionArray)) 
 36          assert(np.allclose(q1.array, q2.array, atol=tol) or 
 37                  np.allclose((-q1).array, q2.array, atol=tol)), \ 
 38                  "QuaternionArrays not almost equal: %r <> %r" %(q1, q2) + \ 
 39                  '\n' + errMsg 
 40      else: 
 41          assert False, "Both arguments must be Quaternions or QuaternionArrays." \ 
 42                  + '\n' + errMsg 

 43   

 44 -def assertMaximumErrorAngle(q1, q2, maximumError, errMsg=""): 

 45      """ 
 46      Assert that the error angle between two quaternions is below a maximum. 
 47      """ 
 48      if isinstance(q1, Quaternion): 
 49          assert(isinstance(q2, Quaternion)) 
 50          error = np.degrees(2*np.arccos((q1*q2.conjugate).w)) 
 51          assert error < maximumError, \ 
 52                  "Angle between quaternions %.2f > %.2f degrees" %( 
 53                      error, maximumError) +'\n' + errMsg 
 54      elif isinstance(q1, QuaternionArray): 
 55          assert(isinstance(q2, QuaternionArray)) 
 56          error = np.degrees(2*np.arccos((q1*q2.conjugate).w)) 
 57          assert max(error) < maximumError, \ 
 58                  "Maximum angle between quaternions %.2f > %.2f degrees" %( 
 59                      max(error), maximumError) +'\n' + errMsg 
 60      else: 
 61          assert False, "Both arguments must be Quaternions or QuaternionArrays."\ 
 62                  +'\n' + errMsg 

 63   

 64 -def assertMaximumRMSErrorAngle(q1, q2, maxRMSE, errMsg=""): 

 65      """ 
 66      Assert that max RMSE between 2 L{QuaternionArray}s is less than maxRMSE. 
 67   
 68      @param q1: The first L{QuaternionArray}. 
 69      @param q2: The second L{QuaternionArray}. 
 70      @param maxRMSE: The maximum allowable RMS error in degrees. 
 71      @param errMsg: Additional errod detail to display if the assertion fails. 
 72      """ 
 73      assert isinstance(q1, QuaternionArray) 
 74      assert isinstance(q2, QuaternionArray) 
 75      errors = np.degrees(2*np.arccos(np.clip(np.abs((q1*q2.conjugate).w),0,1))) 
 76      rmse = np.sqrt(np.mean(errors**2)) 
 77      assert rmse < maxRMSE, 'RMSE between quaternions greater than specified' \ 
 78              " %.2f>%.2f\n%s"%(rmse, maxRMSE, errMsg) 

 79   

 80 -def assert_quaternions_correlated(actual, desired, targetCorrelation=0.95, 
 81          errMsg=""): 

 82      """ 
 83      Assert that correlation between two quaternion arrays is greater than a 
 84      specified target. 
 85   
 86      Correlations are calculated as the diagonal of the upper right quadrant 
 87      of the full correlation matrix. Each of the diagonal elements of this 
 88      sub-matrix represents the correlation between an actual vector component 
 89      and its corresponding desired value. 
 90   
 91      @param actual: Actual L{QuaternionArray}. 
 92      @param desired: Desired L{QuaternionArray}. 
 93      @param targetCorrelation: Minimum correlation to accept. 
 94      @param errMsg: Additional error detail to display if an assertion fails. 
 95      """ 
 96      actual = actual.array.T 
 97      desired = desired.array.T 
 98      correlationMatrix = np.corrcoef(actual, desired) 
 99      s = correlationMatrix.shape[0] / 2 
100      correlationMatrix = correlationMatrix[s:, :s] 
101      correlations = np.diag(correlationMatrix) 
102   
103      assert np.all(correlations > targetCorrelation), "Quaternions are not " \ 
104      "sufficiently correlated. \nCorrelation values: %s\nTarget %.2f"\ 
105          %(correlations, targetCorrelation) + '\n' + errMsg
